intro: Conostegia grayumii, commonly known as the gray's mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly in Florida and along the Gulf Coast. The plant has small, opposite leaves and produces white or pinkish flowers that bloom in the spring. Its berries are typically red or yellow and are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. Conostegia grayumii plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat by influencing host tree growth and supporting local fauna.
